greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = smallest positive m such that m^2=1+k*n with positive k.
comment: Apparently a(n>2)=A070667(n). Note the linear patterns in the graph.
reference: Dorin Andrica, Vlad Crişan, The smallest nontrivial solution to x^k == 1 (mod n) ..., Amer. Math. Monthly 126 (2019), 173-178.
link: Zak Seidov, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
results.author: _Zak Seidov_, Aug 19 2012
